data.title: Giga-Hertz Festival for Electronic Music and Sound Art 2023
data.meta_description: Giga-Hertz-Festival, 5 Tage elektronische Klangkunst am ZKM, 06.12.2023 - 00:00
data.text:
7 pm, Concert, media theater

John Croft »...ne l'aura che trema«, German premiere

Beatrice Dillon »Seven Reorganisations«

Christian Mason »Hölderlin's Madness«, World premiere

Performers

Lotte Betts-Dean (mezzo-soprano)

Thorwald Jørgensen (theremin)

Explore Ensemble

Taylor MacLennan (flute), Sam Roberts (clarinet), George Barton (percussion), Siwan Rhys (piano), Sam Cave (guitar), David López Ibañez (violin), Deni Teo (cello), Nicholas Moroz (electronics)

SWR Experimentalstudio

Tim Abramczik, Joachim Haas & Maurice Oeser (Sound Director)

Mirella Weingarten, Wiebke Pöpel (video installation)

The concert is funded by the state of Baden-Württemberg as part of the aGLOBE project.

9 pm, Concert, Cube

»Acousmatic Dreamland«

By and with Ludger Brümmer

Pieces: »La cloche sans vallées«, »Deconstructing Double District«, »Nyx«

2 pm, BÄM

Workshop Sound@BÄM – special edition of the BÄMlab as part of the Giga-Hertz-Festival

6 pm, Lecture Hall

Book Presentation

The future viability of acoustic ecology: On the new edition of R. Murray Schafer's »The Tuning of the World« presented by Prof. Sabine Breitsameter

PopExperimental concerts

8 pm, Cube

Thomas Köner »Compendium Narcoticum« (Premiere)

9:15 pm, Media Theater

bela (PopExperimental Honorary Mention 2023)

This Machine! (Advancement Award PopExperimental 2023)

10:30 pm, Foyer

Get Together & DJ Performances I:

luxxuryproblems b2b agnes

2 pm, Concert, Cube

»Uncharted Interactions«

World premieres of the production award winners 2021/2022

Yu-Jung Chen »After the Ashes«

with Yangkai Lin (cello)

Yvette Janine Jackson »EXTANT«

Sam Dunscombe (clarinet), Judith Hamann (cello),

SWR Experimentalstudio: Joachim Haas & Maurice Oeser (Sound Directors)

3 pm, artist workshops

Media workshop

Live Coding: Sonic Pi with Michael Vierling

Media theater

»Sonic Meditations« after Pauline Oliveros by and with Blanc Sceol (Stephen Shiell & Hannah White)

From 6:30 pm

Welcome Address

Arne Braun,

State Secretary, Ministry of Science,

Research, and the Arts, Baden-Württemberg

Dominika Szope,

Head of the Department of Cultural Affairs of the City of Karlsruhe

Awarding of the Giga-Hertz Award 2023

with concerts of the 2023 award winners, Cube

This Machine! »Someplace Safer«, 7'30''

Jessica Ekomane »Manifolds«, (2022), for electronics & acousmonium, 17'28''

Lea Bertucci »A Visible Length of Light«, (2021 - 23), for alto saxophone, flute & electronics, 20'

Laurie Spiegel »East River Dawn«, (1976), for GROOVE (minicomputer connected to an analog sound synthesis system), 14'16''

Get Together & DJ Performances II (from 9:30 pm)

OHNOSIGNAL b2b CXXX

From 3 pm, Cube

Lifetime Achievement: Laurie Spiegel

Panel discussion »The Great Unknown: Musicking in the Age of Early Computer Music«

With Bettina Wackernagel, Dorit Chrysler & Ludger Brümmer

in German language

Ludger Brümmer in conversation with Laurie Spiegel

in English language

6 pm, Concert, Cube

»A Chronological Retrospective«

Laurie Spiegel

Statement from Laurie Spiegel about her music and music tech

Laurie Spiegel »Four Short Visits to Different Worlds: I. Swells, II. Mines, III. Crying Tone, IV. A Garden«, (ca. 1971), for Buchla synthesizer

Laurie Spiegel »Pentachrome«, (1974), for the hybrid system GROOVE (minicomputer connected to an analog sound synthesis system)

Laurie Spiegel »Three Modal Pieces: I. A Cosmos, II. A Legend, III. A Myth«, (1982 – 83), for computer-controlled analog synthesizer Mcleyvier

Laurie Spiegel »Passage«, (1987), for Mac IIci, Amiga 1000 & Yamaha TX816 FM Tone Generator System

Laurie Spiegel »Sound Zones«, (ca. 1988), for »Music Mouse«, Mac & Yamaha TX816 FM Tone Generator System

Laurie Spiegel »Improvisation on a ‘Concerto Generator’«, (1977), for Alles Machine (Bell Labs Digital Synthesizer) as video recording

Laurie Spiegel »A Paraphrase«, (2019), for theremin & piano
